availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Clarke (Rowan County, Kentucky, court clerk and attorney)

body.p: Rowan County, Kentucky, clerk and attorney. Nicholas County, Kentucky, native. Son of Fielding Clark and Rebecca Sadler Clark. Married to Mary Goodan Oxley Clarke. Father of Jennie Clark and Leslie Clark. Attended school in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1861. Deputy clerk of the Montgomery Circuit Court in 1862. Attorney in Rowan County in 1863. County attorney of Rowan County in 1865. Assistant U.S. Assessor in Rowan County in 1865.

ab.bibl:

Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Rowan County, KY, September 1863, p. 71.
"James E. Clark." Courier-Journal, (Louisville, KY), 12 Sep 1913, p. 2.
